revised_title: A Study of Dynamic Flow Pressure in Metal Impacts Using Piezo-Electric Method
tldr: The authors conducted an experimental study of impacts between metal bodies using a piezo-electric method to measure the force continuously throughout the impact. They confirmed the theories of elastic impacts by St Venant and Hertz and found that the concept of a constant dynamic flow pressure offers a good representation of the experimental facts. The piezo-electric method also suggested that the enhanced flow pressures experienced in impact cannot be accounted for by forces of a viscous nature.
